desc: Students study the structure, bonding and reactions of compounds containing metal-carbon bonds. Special topics include applications of organometallic chemistry to the synthesis of organic compounds, homogeneous catalysis and biochemistry. Examples illustrate organometallic chemistry as a bridge between organic and inorganic chemistry. Prerequisite: Chemistry 247. Offered during Interim.
name: Organometallic Chem
title: Organometallic Chemistry
